forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: Sunny. High near 63, with temperatures falling to around 61 in the afternoon. West southwest wind around 15 mph, with gusts as high as 22 mph.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Patchy drizzle after 2am. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 55. Southwest wind 7 to 14 mph, with gusts as high as 21 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%.

weather_report:
In Downtown San Francisco, the afternoon unfolds beneath a veil of muted sun, wrestling lightly with an atmosphere that hints at chill and moisture. With temperatures hovering near the mid-sixties, the gentle west-southwest winds craft a playful rustling through the streets, setting the stage for a thoroughly enjoyable day on the cusp of summer. Yet, the whispers of the ocean persist, suggesting a cloak of fog lingers nearby, hinting at an impending marine layer that will likely unfurl its arms after dark.

As evening approaches, the forecast ushers in the promise of patchy drizzle, a soft prelude to the clouds gathering overhead. The air will cool to a comfortable fifty-five, inviting light layers—a cardigan or a light jacket—before descending into the cozy embrace of night. The 20% chance of precipitation brings a gentle allure to the evening, perhaps urging you towards a corner café where the scent of roasted coffee marries well with the pitter-patter of rain. Such a day beckons leisurely strolls through the quiet streets, art galleries, or perhaps a quiet spot to watch the world pass by, all while savoring the ephemeral charm that only a San Francisco twilight can offer.
